treks.title: Kedarkantha
treks.subtitle: A beginner-friendly winter summit
treks.about: Kedarkantha is a short, sharply-rewarding trek famous for its snow-clad forests, rolling meadows and a dawn summit that delivers 360° views of Uttarakhand’s high ranges. Comfortable campsites and well-defined trails make it one of India’s most popular winter climbs for beginners and small groups.
treks.seo_description: Short winter trek in Uttarakhand with sunrise summit and sweeping snow views. Ideal for first-time snow trekkers.

trek_places.name: Sankri Village
trek_places.short: Remote gateway village and trekhead
trek_places.about: Sankri is a lively village that acts as the starting point for Kedarkantha and neighboring treks. It provides basic accommodation, rental gear shops and local eateries. Trekkers use Sankri to acclimatize and meet guides before the trail head.
what_to_do: Check permits and hire local guide
Stock up on supplies and rent winter gear
Walk the village lanes and photograph local life

trek_places.name: Juda Ka Talab
trek_places.short: A frozen alpine lake campsite
trek_places.about: Juda Ka Talab is a photogenic campsite where the lake freezes in winter and pine trees frame the camp. It’s the first real snow experience for many trekkers and a calm place to stargaze.
what_to_do: Walk around the frozen lake edge
Practice snow-walking and photography
Enjoy a calm evening campfire under clear skies

trek_places.name: Kedarkantha Base Camp
trek_places.short: Open snowfield below the summit ridge
trek_places.about: The base camp sits on a wide snow meadow with panoramic views of the ridge and the peaks beyond. It’s the last rest stop before the pre-dawn summit push, offering a dramatic foreground for sunrise photography.
what_to_do: Prepare packs and hydrate for summit day
Capture golden hour and night-sky photos
Rest and check equipment with guides

trek_places.name: Kedarkantha Summit
trek_places.short: A dramatic sunrise viewpoint above the clouds
trek_places.about: The summit rewards trekkers with a near-360° panorama of Himalayan giants like Swargarohini and Bandarpoonch. The ascent is steep but short; the summit is the emotional peak of the trek.
what_to_do: Watch and photograph sunrise over the ranges
Relax and take in the 360° panorama
Use the summit for short reflection/meditation

treks.title: Valley of Flowers
treks.subtitle: Alpine bloom paradise
treks.about: A UNESCO-protected alpine meadow famed for an unrivaled seasonal bloom of wildflowers. The Valley of Flowers is soft on the legs and heavy on the senses: color-drenched meadows, small streams, and a soundtrack of buzzing insects and mountain breezes.
treks.seo_title: Valley of Flowers — Blooming Alpine Meadow
treks.seo_description: UNESCO-protected valley with spectacular seasonal wildflower displays. Perfect for nature lovers and gentle treks.

trek_places.name: Ghangaria
trek_places.short: Base camp and village near the valley
trek_places.about: Ghangaria acts as the base for Valley of Flowers and Hemkund Sahib. Small guesthouses and tea stalls serve trekkers. It’s the jumping-off point for dawn visits into the meadows.
what_to_do: Visit the Valley at dawn for softer light
Shop local handicrafts and snacks
Prepare for Hemkund Sahib side-trip

trek_places.name: Main Valley Meadows
trek_places.short: Carpets of seasonal wildflowers
trek_places.about: The heart of this trek — wide, gently sloped meadows that explode into color during monsoon. The walking is easy, but the visual intensity is high.
what_to_do: Slow-walk and photograph flower carpets
Read interpretive signs about endemic species
Picnic by small alpine streams

treks.title: Brahmatal
treks.subtitle: Frozen lakes & sunrise ridges
treks.about: Brahmatal is a winter-special trek that links high alpine lakes with uncluttered ridge walks and spectacular sunrise views of Trishul and Nanda Ghunti. The open ridgelines and quiet camps make it a favorite for snow landscapes.
treks.seo_description: A snowy trek past frozen lakes and sweeping ridges with views of Trishul and Nanda Ghunti. Ideal for winter landscape photography.

trek_places.name: Gwaldam
trek_places.short: Trail gateway and small staging town
trek_places.about: Gwaldam is a quiet town used as the route’s staging area. It offers last-minute shops and the chance to meet local guides who know winter conditions.
what_to_do: Acquire local info on snow conditions
Buy or rent cold-weather gear
Visit nearby viewpoints at dusk

trek_places.name: Brahmatal Lake
trek_places.short: High-altitude alpine lake
trek_places.about: A serene glacial lake that freezes in winter and sits below a panoramic ridge. Camps near the lake provide broad views of surrounding peaks.
what_to_do: Photograph sunrise reflections
Walk the rim and explore nearby ridgelines
Set up camp and stargaze at night

treks.title: Dayara Bugyal
treks.subtitle: Endless alpine meadows
treks.about: Dayara Bugyal is a vast, rolling meadow famous for its open vistas and easy walking. It’s a gentle trek that rewards with 360° mountain views and tranquil campsites on soft grassy slopes.
treks.seo_description: Large grassy meadows with broad Himalayan views, ideal for calm overnight camping and family treks.

trek_places.name: Main Bugyal
trek_places.short: Open grasslands stretching to the horizon
trek_places.about: The main meadow is the scenic heart of the trek—soft ground, easy walking, and unobstructed views of the surrounding ranges. Perfect for slow walking and broad photos.
what_to_do: Camp in the meadow under clear skies
Walk the ridgelines at sunrise
Picnic and nature observation

treks.title: Hampta Pass
treks.subtitle: Valley-to-desert crossover
treks.about: Hampta Pass is a dramatic crossing between the Kullu valley’s green forests and the stark high deserts of Lahaul–Spiti. The terrain changes quickly, offering river crossings, moraine sections and a striking sense of contrast.
treks.seo_title: Hampta Pass Trek — Kullu to Lahaul Crossover
treks.seo_description: A popular trail that shifts from lush forests to high desert plateaus—ideal for diverse alpine scenery in a short route.

trek_places.name: Jobra
trek_places.short: Entry point with generous valley views
trek_places.about: Jobra is the common trailhead where villagers host trekkers. It’s the last green staging area before the route climbs into higher exposed sections.
what_to_do: Meet guides and check river conditions
Light acclimatisation walks
Enjoy local Himachali food

trek_places.name: Hampta Pass Summit
trek_places.short: The high saddle with wide Lahaul views
trek_places.about: The pass saddle is the dramatic turning point between two worlds—the greenery of Kullu and the arid plateaus below. It’s a high, exposed col with sweeping views and a sense of accomplishment.
what_to_do: Photograph the landscape shift
Enjoy panoramic lunch at the col
Descend carefully into Lahaul side

treks.title: Triund
treks.subtitle: Weekend ridge walk
treks.about: Triund is a short, iconic ridge trek above McLeodganj that offers sweeping views of the Dhauladhar range. It’s popular for weekend trips, sunset camps and easy ridge-side walks accessible to most hikers.
treks.seo_description: Short ridge trek offering panoramic views of the Dhauladhar range. Perfect for weekend hikers and first-time trekkers.

trek_places.name: McLeodganj
trek_places.short: Vibrant hill town and trek gateway
trek_places.about: McLeodganj is a bustling town with cafes, guesthouses and easy access to the Triund trail. It’s an excellent place to prepare, rent light gear and sample local food.
what_to_do: Explore cafes and local markets
Start the trail early to avoid crowds
Visit Bhagsu waterfall before the trek

trek_places.name: Triund Ridge
trek_places.short: Broad grassy ridge with Dhauladhar views
trek_places.about: The ridge is an open meadow area perfect for camping, sunrise and sunset views, and relaxed ridge walks. Camping here feels immediate and rewarding.
what_to_do: Watch sunset over the Dhauladhar
Camp and stargaze
Short ridge walks at dawn

treks.title: Kashmir Great Lakes
treks.subtitle: Alpine lake postcard trails
treks.about: The Kashmir Great Lakes trail stitches together multiple crystal-blue alpine lakes across the Himalayan meadows—each day brings a new postcard view. Rolling meadows, quiet camps and reflective lake basins make it one of India’s most visual treks.
treks.seo_title: Kashmir Great Lakes Trek — Alpine Lakes
treks.seo_description: Multiple blue lakes and alpine meadows across Kashmir. A visual trek with serene camps and panoramic views.

trek_places.name: Aru Valley
trek_places.short: Green gateway village with alpine trails
trek_places.about: Aru is a verdant valley with meadows and traditional guesthouses, used as the entry point for numerous Kashmir treks. It provides strong local support and scenic warm-up walks.
what_to_do: Hire a local guide and check conditions
Explore short meadow walks
Start the main Great Lakes route early

trek_places.name: Tarsar Lake
trek_places.short: Mirror-like alpine lake in a wide basin
trek_places.about: Tarsar is a huge, glassy lake surrounded by ridgelines—its calm surface reflects the sky and mountains, making it an iconic campsite and photo subject.
what_to_do: Camp lakeside and photograph reflections
Walk the shoreline and small ridgelines
Observe alpine birdlife and wildflowers

treks.title: Everest Base Camp (Nepal)
treks.subtitle: Footsteps to the world’s roof
treks.about: Everest Base Camp is the world’s most famous high-altitude trek, threading Sherpa villages, suspension bridges and high viewpoints on the way to the Khumbu icefall. It’s a cultural and physical journey that culminates at the tipping point of Everest climbing.
treks.seo_title: Everest Base Camp Trek — Khumbu Expedition
treks.seo_description: Iconic trek through Sherpa country ending at Everest Base Camp. High altitude, deep culture and legendary views.

trek_places.name: Lukla
trek_places.short: Tiny airstrip and gateway to Khumbu
trek_places.about: Lukla’s short airstrip is the practical gateway to EBC. The town is a jumble of guesthouses, tea shops and trekking logistics—expect brisk energy and last-minute gear runs.
what_to_do: Confirm permits and flights to Kathmandu
Meet Sherpa crew and check kit
Begin acclimatisation walks on the lower trails

trek_places.name: Namche Bazaar
trek_places.short: High Sherpa market and acclimatisation hub
trek_places.about: Namche is the main acclimatisation stop with bakeries, gear shops and a lively market. Trekkers linger here for two nights to adjust and relish the unique mountain culture.
what_to_do: Acclimatise and hike to nearby viewpoints
Stock up on supplies and enjoy bakeries
Visit Sherpa museums and cultural exhibits

treks.title: Markha Valley
treks.subtitle: Ladakh’s green valley route
treks.about: Markha Valley is a lush corridor in Ladakh that connects high desert plateaus with villages, gompas and rugged side ridges. The trail offers surprising green camps, river crossings and a chance to meet remote Himalayan communities.
treks.seo_title: Markha Valley Trek — Ladakh Village Trails
treks.seo_description: A scenic Ladakh trek through green valleys, remote villages and dramatic high desert landscapes.

trek_places.name: Markha Village
trek_places.short: Traditional village and first campsite
trek_places.about: Markha gives an intimate look at Ladakhi mountain agriculture and hospitality. Trekkers often stay in local homestays and learn about traditional life.
what_to_do: Explore village life and gompas
Taste local Ladakhi cuisine
Walk the nearby fields and photogenic lanes

treks.title: Har Ki Dun
treks.subtitle: Valley of Gods
treks.about: Har Ki Dun is a cradle-shaped valley steeped in mythology and stunning alpine scenery. Accessible through ancient wooden villages, the trail offers constant views of the Swargarohini peaks and walks through pine forests that surely feel timeless.
treks.seo_title: Har Ki Dun Trek — Valley of Gods
treks.seo_description: A cultural and scenic trek to the Valley of Gods with views of Swargarohini peaks and ancient wooden villages.

trek_places.name: Osla Village
trek_places.short: Ancient wooden village with heavy culture
trek_places.about: Osla is a time-capsule village featuring intricate wooden architecture and a unique temple often associated with Duruyodhana. It's a living museum of mountain culture.
what_to_do: Admire the wooden architecture
Interact with locals about their legends
Photograph the village against the valley backdrop

trek_places.name: Har Ki Dun Campsite
trek_places.short: River-side camping with peak views
trek_places.about: The main campsite sits by the Maninda river, right below the imposing Swargarohini peaks. It is a spacious, grassy area that invites long hours of just staring at the mountains.
what_to_do: Walk to Jaundhar Glacier viewpoint
Relax by the river stream
Watch the sunset hit Swargarohini

treks.title: Annapurna Base Camp
treks.subtitle: Sanctuary of the giants
treks.about: The trek to Annapurna Base Camp traverses through diverse terrain from terraced rice fields to the high-altitude Annapurna Sanctuary. It is an amphitheater of mountains where trekkers stand surrounded by some of the highest peaks on Earth.
treks.seo_title: Annapurna Base Camp Trek — Himalayan Sanctuary
treks.seo_description: Trek into the heart of the Annapurna Sanctuary, surrounded by towering 8000m peaks. A classic Himalayan tea-house trek.

trek_places.name: Machapuchare Base Camp
trek_places.short: The gateway to the inner sanctuary
trek_places.about: MBC offers a prelude to the main sanctuary with up-close views of the sacred 'Fishtail' peak. It’s a colder, starker landscape that builds anticipation for the final push.
what_to_do: Wake up early for alpenglow on Machapuchare
Acclimatize before the final ascent
Enjoy hot soup in the teahouse dining hall

trek_places.name: Annapurna Base Camp
trek_places.short: The 360-degree mountain amphitheater
trek_places.about: Standing at ABC feels like being in the palm of the mountains' hands. You are surrounded by Annapurna I, South, and Hiunchuli—a humbling and majestic experience.
what_to_do: Watch the sunrise light up the Annapurna massif
Visit the memorial chortens
Take panoramic photos of the 360-degree view

treks.title: Beas Kund
treks.subtitle: Source of the Beas River
treks.about: Beas Kund is a rewarding short trek that takes you to the glacial lake source of the Beas River. Starting from Solang Valley, it offers quick access to high-altitude scenery with Hanuman Tibba and the Seven Sisters peaks looming large.
treks.seo_title: Beas Kund Trek — Manali Glacial Lake
treks.seo_description: A short but spectacular trek from Manali to the glacial Beas Kund lake, offering massive views of summits like Hanuman Tibba.

trek_places.name: Dhundi
trek_places.short: Scenic start of the trail
trek_places.about: Dhundi is the road-head where the trek begins, offering the first clear views of the high peaks. The walk from here follows the river through birch forests.
what_to_do: Start the walk through the forest
Spot the Seven Sisters peaks
Enjoy the riverside trail

trek_places.name: Beas Kund Lake
trek_places.short: Small glacial lake at the base of peaks
trek_places.about: The lake itself is small but the setting is grand, sitting in a bowl formed by high peaks. Legends say Sage Vyas meditated here; it’s a peaceful spot for reflection.
what_to_do: Sit by the clear glacial water
Identify the surrounding peaks
Explore the moraine ridges nearby
